page.title: 19ST.NICHOLAS & ST. FAITH CH.
page.content: THE NAME{ST.NICHOLAS}IS QUITE RARE IN CORNWALL. APART FROM THE ONE IN SALTASH THERE ARE ONLY 3 OTHER CHURCHES WITH THIS NAME IN THE WHOLE OF THE COUNTY. ST.NICHOLAS IS THE PATRON SAINT OF SAILORS. THE CHURCH TOWER WAS BUILT BY THE NORMANS BUT THE BATTLEMENTS WERE REMOVED IN 1730. IT WAS ONLY A CHAPEL OF EASE UNTIL 1881 WHEN IT THEN BECAME THE PARISH CHURCH OF SALTASH. THE KEYS OF THE CHURCH WERE KEPT BY THE MAYOR AND THE CHAPLAIN WAS PAID BY THE CORPORATION. THE BELL ROPE WAS CHARGED ON THE RATES BUT THE CORPORATION WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL REPAIRS ON THE CHURCH. THE LAST TREES AROUND THE CHURCH WERE REMOVED IN 1962 TO MAKE ROOM FOR THE GRAVEYARD.
